citations.narrative:
During the inspection a single budgerigar was seen climbing on the outside of the budgerigar enclosure, it had escaped
from the enclosure. Enclosures that do not securely contain animals can lead to unintentional or accidental escape and
injury of the animals. The budgerigar enclosure must be designed and constructed to ensure that the birds are contained
securely.
Correct by: October 24, 2023.

An enclosure containing 4 pigeons had no shelter within the primary enclosure.
Birds housed in enclosures that do not provide adequate protection from environmental extremes may suffer from stress,
discomfort or even death. All birds must be housed in enclosures that provide shelter and protection from climatic and
environmental conditions.
Correct by: October 24, 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The avian environmental enhancement plan available at time of inspection had not been approved by the attending
veterinarian. A written plan for environment enrichment is necessary to ensure the psychological well-being and overall
health of the birds. An environment enhancement plan must be developed, documented, and be species- appropriate.
The plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian and must address social grouping, environmental enrichment,
special considerations, restraint devices, and exemptions.
Correct by: October 24, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.153(a)(1)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
During the inspection a single budgerigar was seen climbing on the outside of the budgerigar enclosure, it had escaped 
from the enclosure. Enclosures that do not securely contain animals can lead to unintentional or accidental escape and 
injury of the animals. The budgerigar enclosure must be designed and constructed to ensure that the birds are contained 
securely. 
Correct by: October 24, 2023. 
3.153(a)(1)(vi) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
An enclosure containing 4 pigeons had no shelter within the primary enclosure.  
Birds housed in enclosures that do not provide adequate protection from environmental extremes may suffer from stress, 
discomfort or even death. All birds must be housed in enclosures that provide shelter and protection from climatic and 
environmental conditions. 
Correct by: October 24, 2023. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The avian environmental enhancement plan available at time of inspection had not been approved by the attending 
veterinarian. A written plan for environment enrichment is necessary to ensure the psychological well-being and overall 
health of the birds. An environment enhancement plan must be developed, documented, and be species- appropriate. 
The plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian and must address social grouping, environmental enrichment, 
special considerations, restraint devices, and exemptions. 
Correct by: October 24, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
